Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.model

Class SantoriniGame

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.model.SantoriniGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
TurnBasedGame
public class SantoriniGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements TurnBasedGame
Brief Main Singleton class of the whole game, storing the informations about the map, the players and other parameters and communicating with the controller through an interface

    void setupGame()
    Brief This method is divided in steps, also based on the rulebook's Setup section: 1) Map creation (rulebook's steps 1 and 2) 2) Players log in 3) Game mode request: if BASIC, loads the basic rules and randomly chooses the first player then goes to step 4) 3.1) Poll for the most god-like player election (rulebook's step 3) 3.2) God powers selection and "reading" (rulebook's steps 3, 4 and 5) 3.3) Cards assignment in clockwise order (rulebook's step 6) 3.4) First player choice (rulebook's step 7) 4) Workers selection and positioning (rulebook's step 7)
    void startGame()
    Brief Calls the current player's turn handler, then chooses the next player and ends the game if there's a winner

  • Constructor Details

    • SantoriniGame

      public SantoriniGame​(GameDelegate delegate, java.lang.Integer numberOfPlayers)
      Brief Creates a new instance of SantoriniGame
      Parameters:
      delegate - is the GameDelegate who communicates with the controller
      numberOfPlayers - is the number of players in game

  • Method Details

    • setupGame

      public void setupGame()
      Brief This method is divided in steps, also based on the rulebook's Setup section: 1) Map creation (rulebook's steps 1 and 2) 2) Players log in 3) Game mode request: if BASIC, loads the basic rules and randomly chooses the first player then goes to step 4) 3.1) Poll for the most god-like player election (rulebook's step 3) 3.2) God powers selection and "reading" (rulebook's steps 3, 4 and 5) 3.3) Cards assignment in clockwise order (rulebook's step 6) 3.4) First player choice (rulebook's step 7) 4) Workers selection and positioning (rulebook's step 7)
      Specified by:
      setupGame in interface TurnBasedGame

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Brief Calls the current player's turn handler, then chooses the next player and ends the game if there's a winner
      Specified by:
      startGame in interface TurnBasedGame

    • gameCycle

      private void gameCycle()

    • handleTurn

      public void handleTurn​(Player player, java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Boolean> onCompletion)
      Brief Handles the current turn
      Specified by:
      handleTurn in interface TurnBasedGame
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who plays the current turn
      onCompletion - true if there's a winner, otherwise false

    • checkWin

      private void checkWin​(Player player, java.lang.Boolean win, java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Boolean> onCompletion)
      Brief checks the victory condition for the current turn
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who plays the current turn
      win - is true in case of win, false in case of loss
      onCompletion - true if there's a winner, otherwise false

    • logIn

      private void logIn()
      Brief Accepts a player asking him to insert a username

    • loadBasicRules

      private void loadBasicRules​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      Brief Loads basic rules to each player, giving them a special card with id equals to 0
      Parameters:
      players - are the players in game

    • godLikePlayerChoice

      private Player godLikePlayerChoice​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, Poll poll)
      Brief Sends a Poll to all the players to let them choose the most "god-like" player
      Parameters:
      players - contains a reference to every player
      poll - is an instance containing a question and a voting method
      Returns:
      the most god-like player

    • cardsSelection

      private void cardsSelection​(Player godLikePlayer)
      Brief Asks the god-like player to select a number of cards equal to the number of players in game
      Parameters:
      godLikePlayer - is the player who must choose the cards

    • assignCards

      private void assignCards​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsToAssign, Player godLikePlayer)
      Brief Assigns one of the selected cards in clockwise order to each player
      Parameters:
      cardsToAssign - are the cards to assign
      godLikePlayer - is the last player who receives the card

    • getUnassignedPositions

      private java.util.ArrayList<Position> getUnassignedPositions()
      Brief This method is called at the very beginning of the game, when players have to place their workers on the map
      Returns:
      all the positions in the map, because initially they're all free

    • selectWorker

      private void selectWorker​(java.util.ArrayList<Position> freePositions)
      Brief Requests to choose a color to the player and then to place his two workers on the board
      Parameters:
      freePositions - are the available positions on the board

    • assignWorkers

      private void assignWorkers​(java.lang.Integer playerId, java.lang.String color, java.util.ArrayList<Position> freePositions)
      Brief Assigns the workers to a player
      Parameters:
      playerId - is the id of the player who chose to control these workers
      color - is the color of the chosen workers
      freePositions - contains all positions not yet occupied by a worker

    • placeWorkers

      private void placeWorkers​(java.util.ArrayList<Worker> workers, java.lang.String color, java.lang.Integer playerId, java.util.ArrayList<Position> freePositions)
      Brief Places one by one all the workers on the board and deletes their position from the allowed ones
      Parameters:
      workers - are the workers to be placed, then assigned
      color - is the available chosen color
      playerId - is the id of the player who needs the assignment
      freePositions - contains all the positions not yet occupied by a worker

    • getPlayersHandler

      public PlayersHandler getPlayersHandler()

      public static GameMode getMode()

      public static void createMap()
      Brief Creates a new GameMap

    • informPlayers

      private void informPlayers​(Player player, java.lang.String notificationMessage, java.lang.String victoryMessage, boolean gameOver)
      Brief Informs the players if there is a winner or a loser, removing him from the list of players currently in game
      Parameters:
      player - is the winner or the loser
      notificationMessage - is the message to send to all the players except the winner/loser
      victoryMessage - is the message to send to the winner/loser
      gameOver - is true if the game will end after this notification process

    • removeWorkers

      public static void removeWorkers​(Player player)
      Brief Removes from the map the workers of a certain player
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who generally lost a game
